entries.title: Another major HIV vaccine trial fails
entries.description: The Mosaico trial was halted early after its vaccine failed to prevent HIV in men who have sex with men and transgender people in the Americas and Europe.

entries.title: Venezuelans describe dangers and desperation amid U.S. asylum changes
entries.description: Venezuelan migrants in Mexico are facing more challenges in seeking asylum in the U.S. from Title 42 and recent U.S. policy changes as they weigh what to do next.

entries.title: Church of England bishops refuse to allow same-sex marriages
entries.description: The Church of England will refuse to allow same-sex couples to get married in its churches under proposals set out on Wednesday in which the centuries-old

entries.title: Mexico’s Maya Train will need over 6,500 permanent officers to guard tracks
entries.description: The environmental and financial costs of Mexico’s Maya Train tourism project are already massive, but authorities revealed another, unexpected cost.

entries.title: Brazil presents charges against Jan. 8 pro-Bolsonaro riot participants
entries.description: The office of Brazil’s prosecutor-general has presented its first charges against some of the thousands who authorities say stormed government buildings.

entries.title: Zelenskyy honors victims of deadly helicopter crash in World Economic Forum address
entries.description: During a virtual address to the World Economic Forum, Ukrainian President Zelenskyy honored the victims of a deadly helicopter crash near Kyiv and called on the West to speed up its support for Ukraine.

entries.title: Nurses in England strike over pay and deteriorating NHS
entries.description: Tens of thousands of nurses in England are estimated to have walked off of work as part of an unprecedented strike shaking the country’s troubled National Health Service.

entries.title: Thousands of nurses walk off work in England as part of unprecedented strike
entries.description: Tens of thousands of nurses in England are estimated to have walked off of work on Wednesday as part of a huge strike hitting the National Health Service.

entries.title: French city asks Madonna to lend it a painting lost during WW1
entries.description: The mayor of Amiens, in northern France, has asked Madonna to lend the city a 19th-century painting lost during World War One.

entries.title: Helicopter crash in Ukraine kills at least 14, including interior minister
entries.description: Ukrainian police say the country’s top interior ministry official is among at least 14 killed in a helicopter crash near Kyiv Wednesday. An investigation into the cause is underway. NBC's Raf Sanchez reports for TODAY.

entries.title: Helicopter crash in Ukraine kills at least 16, including interior minister
entries.description: Ukrainian police say the country’s top interior ministry official is among at least 16 killed in a helicopter crash near Kyiv Wednesday. An investigation into the cause is underway. NBC's Raf Sanchez reports for TODAY.

entries.title: Qantas plane lands safely after mayday call over Pacific
entries.description: A Qantas flight traveling from New Zealand to Sydney landed safely on a single engine after it issued a mayday call over the Pacific Ocean on Wednesday.

entries.title: Tearful Nobel laureate Maria Ressa reacts to tax evasion acquittal
entries.description: A Philippine tax court on Wednesday cleared Nobel Peace Prize winner Maria Ressa and her online news company of tax evasion charges.

entries.title: French mayor appeals to Madonna to lend artwork
entries.description: The mayor of Amiens, northern France, has asked Madonna to lend the city a 19th-century painting, lost during World War I, which it believes may be have been bought by the singer to help its chances of becoming 2028 European Capital of Culture.

entries.title: Marvel films are returning to China after three years of an apparent ban
entries.description: Marvel films are set to be released on screens in mainland China for the first time in more than three years, ending an apparent ban.

entries.title: At least 18 killed in helicopter crash in Kyiv suburb
entries.description: At least 18 people were killed, including Ukraine's interior minister and three children, when a helicopter crashed near to a kindergarten in a suburb of Kyiv.

entries.title: Helicopter crash outside Kyiv kills at least 18 people, including Ukraine's interior minister
entries.description: At least 18 people are dead, including Ukraine's interior minister and three children, after a helicopter crashed near a kindergarten outside Kyiv on Wednesday.

entries.title: Journalist Maria Ressa cleared of tax evasion by Philippine court, calling it a win for justice
entries.description: Philippine Nobel laureate Maria Ressa and her news site Rappler were acquitted by a court of tax evasion charges on Wednesday, a judge said.

entries.title: Centenarian nun thought to be the world's oldest person dies at 118
entries.description: French nun Sister Andre, the world’s oldest person, passed away at 118 in France, her retirement home told Reuters on Tuesday.

entries.title: West must ramp up aid to Ukraine to keep war with Russia from becoming a stalemate, U.K. foreign secretary says
entries.description: The West must ramp up military assistance to Ukraine to ensure the war with Russia doesn't become a bloody stalemate, U.K. Foreign Secretary James Cleverly said.
